title: Why this inconsistency?
comment:
The pro-life argument quite plainly revolves around the premise that fetuses are human beings, and therefore have a right to life. However, many (if not all) pro-lifers say that they will allow abortions in the "extreme cases" of rape or incest. Now, what does that imply? Rape/incest fetuses aren't human beings, while others are? Pro-lifers say that they don't want the government picking and choosing who has the right to life and who doesn't, but this sounds like picking and choosing to me.
I think this inconsistency effectively nullifies the pro-life argument. Of course, to get rid of the inconsistency, the pro-lifers can bring rape and incest babies into the sphere of protected beings. The result - a horribly unreasonable position I can't suport.

title: Why this inconsistency?
comment:
I find the same thing. I've met few people who had no abortion exceptions: pls usually agree with health abortions IME.
The rape and incest things is strange and comes down to the fact that she didn't willingly have sex. And? It's murder if you had consensual sex but not if you didn't? It doesn't make sense. On the other hand, if they are consistent and condemn abortions in those circumstances...I find that horrific. Just my opinion.
I'm pro-choice because I understand how traumatic an unwanted pregnancy is and because I think calling a zef a baby is absurd. Any unwanted pregnancy is traumatic, not just rape related ones.

comment: Now that's just scary, I must say.

title: Why this inconsistency?
comment:
I guess it's because some pro-lifers have been brainwashed (as well as many pro-abortionists) that aborting a baby conceived by rape or incest will heal, or be a help to the victim. 
I, myself, have come to the conclusion that abortions hurt much more than they heal. Not just phsyically (Side effects can occure months afterward) but psychologically as well. Guilt, depression, so forth. 
In my view, abortion is murder, one way or the other and rare extreme cases don't justify its legality. Even the rape victim gets a better chance than the baby does. They're at least alive while they kill their baby. That in itself will eat at the person for years until they find some way of forgiving themselves.
I believe these testimonies to be real, and I feel sorry for those victims who feel obligated because of family relations' repuations to kill their own child. It really is sad.

title: Why this inconsistency?

until, as you said: Hopefully, the person "finds some way of forgiving themselves", right. 
But what about in the mean-time? - And we know, from research & quite a number of Healers, that rot (inside a person) is damaging... and often in very unsuspecting ways.
Much better to life benevolently, in the first place.
Annie

title: Why this inconsistency?
comment:
Many people would allow abortions in extreme cases because they figure that since extreme cases make up about 5% of abortions then if they can get all but extreme cases then they will be saving at least 95%, which is better than nothing. After that they can work towards stopping all abortions. It's a step-by-step process. 
I say abortion of all kinds should be illegal. 95% of abortions are a result of consentual sex. We shouldn't cater to the 5% just because they've had a tough situation. I sympathize with them and would do what I could to help them, but they do still need to have the baby, whether they give it up for adoption or not. This isn't a horribly unreasonable position. It's just a difficult position. Saying it's alright to kill a baby for any reason is a horribly unreasonable position.
People need to face the facts too. Sex isn't there for pleasure, it's there for procreation and happens to be pleasureable. Someone who indulges in this pleasure should be ready to deal with the outcome, which oftentimes is a baby.

title: Why this inconsistency?
comment:
Hmmm, sapient actually has two meanings.
The first is fine, sapient meaning wise, but there is a second, satirical meaning, "aping" wisdom, fancied sagacity, in other words, pretending to a wisdom that is quite beyond one.
Furthermore, not every human being is wise, no matter how long that particular human being studies and studies and tries to be wise. Wisdom is sometimes beyond the reach of such individuals. Nevertheless, they are not less human because of this lack of wisom. Humanity has its share of fools.
Sentient, having the power to perceive. I would add that to be totally human, one must have the power to perceive and process in a reasonably rational fashion. All animals with sensory organs are sentient. They perceive through scent, sight, sound, taste, sense of movement, tactile sensations and process enough of these perceptions for survival.
